definition: young disciple (of the same master)/younger or junior male schoolmate
younger brother/junior male/I (modest word in letter)

sentences.english: I remember I met a student of grade two in a meeting in our business school.
sentences.chinese: 记得在一次学院的开会中，遇到一个大二的师弟。

sentences.english: Relieve inflammation or internal heat the truth now live eight teacher younger brother, also is the life is grim.
sentences.chinese: 败火直言眼下活着的八位师弟，也是性命堪忧了。

sentences.english: He is the brother bright clouds.
sentences.chinese: 原来他是流云的师弟皓月。

sentences.english: The men who sat next to us are good at Kongfu, they have studied in the same Kongfu school with Jet Lee.
sentences.chinese: 旁边坐着的是我们中国功夫的传人，李连杰的师弟们。

sentences.english: My son sold to a little teacher younger brother by 30 pieces of a catty price.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿子以三十块一斤的价格卖给了一个小师弟。

sentences.english: In recent days, many students will move here.
sentences.chinese: 最近几天，很多师弟师妹将搬过来这边。

sentences.english: My little brothers and sisters will go to school soon.
sentences.chinese: 我的师弟师妹快要上学了，应该可以看的到。

definition: junior female student or apprentice/daughter (younger than oneself) of one's teacher
senior male fellow student or apprentice/son (older than oneself) of one's teacher
senior female fellow student or apprentice/daughter (older than oneself) of one's teacher
head of a clan/natural leader/person of prestige and authority in a domain/suzerain
used for 師傅|师傅 (in Taiwan)/master/qualified worker
(affectionate form of address for a male who is not very much younger than oneself) my boy/old pal
to keep the law/to protect Buddha's teachings/protector of Buddhist law (i.e. temple donor)
founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
